changelog.title: Latest updates
changelog.heat_details: {LINK} is a Twitch extensions allowing viewers to click on your stream. Twitchat makes it dead easy to use it.

highlights.d:
Read your Twitch and Youtube chats in one place!

Due to the catastrophic and absurdly limited nature of the Youtube API, this feature is currently reserved for premium members to ensure minimal service.

Display credits roll at the end of your stream.

Comes with sh*t tons of exclusive options you won't find anywhere else!

Make bits rain on your stream! Comes with 2 never-seen-before features:
  • Allow viewers to "break" bits by clicking on them with the {HEAT} extension
  • Enable advanced rendering that distorts your stream image behind crystals thanks to the OBS plugin {SHADERTASTIC}

Allow your viewers to temporarily distort your stream by clicking on it through the {HEAT} extension using the new interactive distortions overlay.
Clicks can also be simulated from Triggers.

Get alerted when an ad is approaching or currently playing.
  • Skip the ad with the snooze button.
  • Automate actions when an ad approaches, starts, or ends using Triggers.
  • Show the approaching ad or remaining duration of a playing ad with the new dedicated overlay.

Automatically translate the 1st message of user on your channel if it's not written in your language.

Or translate any message from the new context menu option.

This feature costing me money, it's limited to premium members.

Create Questions & Answers sessions with your viewers

Find all the questions back on dedicated lists and highlight them on stream thanks to the dedicated overlay!

Manage your channel points rewards directly from Twitchat!
Change their price, enable/disable them, hide them, or rename them with just one click.

Automate their creation or modification from triggers for even more possibilities!

Manage your Twitch extensions directly from Twitchat!

Manually enable or disable them from the new dedicated menu, or automatically from triggers.

For example, enable an extension only when on a specific OBS scene, a specific stream category, in response to channel points rewards, subs, or anything else you can imagine!

Check the history of a viewer on all the channels you moderate in a few clicks.

The user profile window can now offer you a button for each of the channels you moderate to easily check their message history on those channels.

Two new chat notifications will tell you when a song is added to your Spotify playlist or if a song request fails with the reason for the failure.

A user is trolling your song request? Block them from adding more tracks with a single click.

A new option also allows you to accept only songs that are less than a certain duration.

Display messages only you can see.

Send them either through Triggers or via the new dedicated Twitchat API.
Ideal for notifying yourself of various personalized events if you are a developer.

Launch raffles from the entries of a Value.

This can allow you to create multiple raffle lists in parallel using the Triggers system, then draw a winner from its entries at any time.
Don't be overwhelmed by all the Twitchat options by customizing the settings menu to display only the sections of your choice, in the order of your choice.

• Organize your triggers into folders and subfolders
  • 6 new trigger events:
    • Approaching an ad
    • Start of an ad
    • End of an ad
    • Failure to add a track to Spotify
    • Any channel points reward is redeemed
    • Heat click anywhere on the screen
    • Q&A session started
    • Q&A session closed
    • Q&A session deleted
  • 4 new trigger actions:
    • Create/disable/enable/delete a channel points reward
    • Enable/disable a Twitch extension
    • Show a custom notification
    • Simulate a click on a distortion overlay
  • 3 new OBS actions:
    • Stop a media
    • Next media
    • Previous media
  • 1 new Counter & Value action:
    • Edit the value for all your current viewers
  • 21 new placeholders:
    • {NOW} current date
    • {MY_STREAM_DURATION}
    • {MY_STREAM_DURATION_MS}
    • {MY_STREAM_LIVE}
    • {SPOTIFY_IS_PLAYING}
    • {CURRENT_PLAYLIST_URL}
    • {CURRENT_PLAYLIST_TITLE}
    • {CURRENT_PLAYLIST_COVER}
    • {TWITCH_LAST_SUB}
    • {TWITCH_LAST_SUB_ID}
    • {TWITCH_LAST_SUBGIFTER}
    • {TWITCH_LAST_SUBGIFTER_ID}
    • {TWITCH_TOTAL_SUBS_ACTIVE}
    • {TWITCH_LAST_FOLLOW}
    • {TWITCH_LAST_FOLLOW_ID}
    • {TWITCH_TOTAL_FOLLOWERS}
    • {TWITCH_LAST_CHEER}
    • {TWITCH_LAST_CHEER_ID}
    • {TWITCH_LAST_CHEER_AMOUNT}
    • {FAIL_REASON} for Spotify action
    • {SEARCH_QUERY} for Spotify action

Twitchat has been my main activity for over a year and a half now without any other source of income. If you can afford it, a one-time donation or monthly support on Patreon would help me a lot ‚ù§Ô∏è
